revised_title: Neuropeptides S1 and S2 in Starfish Digestive System
tldr: This study examines the tissue distribution and cellular localization of the SALMFamide neuropeptides S1 and S2 in the starfish Asterias rubens using novel monoclonal and polyclonal antibodies. The results reveal a widespread neuronal localization for S2 in the digestive system, with separate localization for S1 and S2 immunoreactivity. These findings suggest a role for these neuropeptides in the starfish digestive system, particularly in gut relaxation.
